conclusion: The problem involves four homogeneous spheres stacked in a cone shape.
The bottom three balls A, B, and C are tied with a rope in the same horizontal plane as their centers.
Ball D is placed above the three balls in a static state.
The mass of each ball is m.
The only force acting on ball D is the gravitational force and the normal force from the three balls.
The normal force from the three balls is equal and opposite to the gravitational force.
The pressure of ball D on the three balls is equal to the gravitational force divided by 3.
The pressure of ball D on the three balls is 2mg/3.
